algorithm_technique: Iterate through all possible top-left corners of 3x3 subgrids and find the maximum within each.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum value in every 3x3 subgrid of a larger matrix.
problem_summary_technical: Generates a new matrix where each element is the maximum of a 3x3 window in the input grid.
time_complexity: O(n*m) where n and m are dimensions of the grid, effectively O(N^2) for an N x N grid.
space_complexity: O(1) if output matrix is not counted, O((n-2)*(m-2)) if it is.
key_insights: The problem requires iterating through all possible 3x3 windows.
For each window, a simple scan to find the maximum is sufficient.
The output matrix size is (n-2) x (m-2).
